qas.question: Why didn't Soviets create fake elections in Poland?
Where did the Nazi and Russian leaders meet to discuss what not to do with Poland?
Where weren't cooperative military parades held?
Where were cooperative military parades not held?

context: On 21 September, the Soviets and Germans signed a formal agreement coordinating military movements in Poland, including the "purging" of saboteurs. A joint German–Soviet parade was held in <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>Lvov and <a1_0><b5_0>Brest-Litovsk<b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/><a1_0/>, while the countries commanders met in the latter location. Stalin had decided in August that he was going to liquidate the Polish state, and a German–Soviet meeting in September addressed the future structure of the "Polish region". Soviet authorities immediately started a campaign of Sovietization of the newly acquired areas. The Soviets organized staged elections, the result of which was to become <b3_0><b4_0>a <a0_0>legitimization of Soviet annexation of eastern Poland<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/>.
